q:
What will be the modified array (arr) after executing the given Pseudocode:

Pseudocode

DECLARE arr : ARRAY[0,6] of {23,54,21,31,56,78,65}
p1 = 0
p2 = 6

WHILE p1<p2
	t = arr[p1]
	arr[p1] = arr[p2]
	arr[p2] = t
	p1 = p1 + 1
	p2 = p2 - 1
ENDWHILE
Bob is working on Ruby on Rails. He wants to implement string interpolation in his array of strings. Then which of the following options can he choose for the purpose?

In Data Structures, you are working on Arrays. You are given a Pseudocode that implements various operations on the given array. Which of the following options best fit in Line 10 and Line 12 so that the output will be 4, 9?

Pseudocode

DECLARE arr : ARRAY[0,8] of { 1, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9, 13, 15, 16 }
k = 13
p1 = 0
p2 = 8
WHILE p1<p2
	IF arr[p1]+arr[p2]==k
		PRINT (arr[p1],arr[p2])
		BREAK
	ELSE IF arr[p1]+arr[p2]<k
		// Line 10
	ELSE IF arr[p1]+arr[p2]>K
		// Line 12
	ENDIF
ENDWHILE

Now, select the option that best fit in the comments in Line 10 and Line 12 such that when you implement the pseudocode in your own programming, the output is 4, 9.

Options

1. 

p1+=1
p2+=1

2. 

p1+=1
p2-=1

3. 

p1-=1
p2+=1

4. 

p1-=1
p2-=1

Which of the following statements is correct if the C# code given below is executed?

Code

using System;

public class Test
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        int[] array = { 4, 16, 27, 39, 74, 82, 99};
        fun(array );
        Console.WriteLine(array + " ");
    }
    static void fun(params int [] bArray )
    {
        int [] cArray = { 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9};
        int i ;
        for (i = 0 ;i < bArray.Length ;i++)
        if (bArray[i] % 2 == 0)
        {
            cArray [i] = bArray [i];
            
        }
        for (i = 0 ;i <= bArray .Length ;i++)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(cArray [i]);
            
        }
    }
}

Output:

  1. 4
16
5
6
74
82
9
  2. Runtime Error
  3. Compile time Error ​
  4. 4
16
27
6
74
82
9

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

a=[15,12,8,3,5,18]
n=6
temp1=a[0]
temp2=-1
i=0
while i<n
  if temp1>a[i]
    temp1=a[i]
    temp2=i
  end
  i+=1
end
puts temp2

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

a=[1,3,4,2,5,7,9,8]
n=8
temp=0
i=0
while i<n
  if a[i]%2==0
    a[temp]=a[i]
    temp+=1
  end
  i+=1
end
i=0
while i<n
  if a[i]%2!=0
    a[temp]=a[i]
    temp+=1
  end
  i+=1
end
i=0
res=0
while i<n-3
  res+=a[i]
  i+=1
end
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

def func1(a,n)
  if n==1
    return 0
  end
  i=0
  while i<n-1
    if a[i]!=0 and a[i]==a[i+1]
      a[i]=2*a[i]
      a[i+1]=0
      i+=1
    end
    i+=1
  end
  func2(a,n)
end
def func2(a,n)
  temp=0
  i=0
  while i<n
    if a[i]!=0
      a[temp+1]=a[i]
      temp+=1
    end
    i+=1
  end
  while temp<n
    a[temp+1]=0
    temp+=1
  end
end

a=[0,2,2,3,0,4,6,2,0,0,8]
n=11
res=func1(a,n)
i=0
while i<n
  print a[i]
  print " "
  i+=1
end

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

a=[2,7,9,5,8,7,4]
n=7
k=5
temp=0
i=0
while i<n
  if a[i]<=k
    temp+=1
  end
  i+=1
end
temp1=0
i=0
while i<temp
  if a[i]>k
    temp1+=1
  end
  i+=1
end
res=temp1
i=0
j=temp
while j<n
  if a[i]>k
    temp1-=1
  end
  if a[j]>k
    temp1+=1
  end
  if res>temp1
    res=temp1
  end
  i+=1
  j+=1
end
puts res

What is the output of the given Ruby code:

Code

a1=[1,2,3,4,5]
n=2
a2=[[0,2],[0,3]]
res=1
i=n-1
while i>=0
  temp1=a2[i][0]
  temp2=a2[i][1]
  if temp1<=res and temp2>=res
    if res==temp1
      res=temp2
    else
      res-=1
    end
  end
  i-=1
end
puts a1[res]

What is the output to the following code:

Code

#import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
 
int main () {
   
   /* an array with 5 rows and 2 columns*/
   int array[1][2] = {{5,5}};
   int s, k;
 
   /* output each array element's value */
   for ( s = 0; s < 1; s++ ) {
      for ( k = 0; k < 2; k++ ) {
         NSLog(@"array[%d][%d] = %d\n", s,k, array[s][k] );
      }
   }
   
   return 0;
}

What is the output to the following code:

Code

#import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
 @interface SampleClass:NSObject
-(double) getAverage:(int []) arr andSize:(int) size;
@end
@implementation SampleClass-(double) getAverage:(int []) Array andSize:(int) S {
   int    d;
   double average, SUM =0;;
   for (d = 0; d < S; ++d) {
      SUM += Array[d];  }
   average = SUM/ S;
   return average;  }
@end
int main () {
   int b[5] = {1, 500, 370, 58, 24};
   double average;
   SampleClass *sampleClass = [[SampleClass alloc]init];
  average = [sampleClass getAverage:b andSize: 5] ;
   NSLog( @"Average value is: %f ", average );
  return 0; }

What is the output of the given code snippet:

import java.util.Arrays
fun main(){
   val arr=intArrayOf(5, 3, 6, 2, 4, -1, 0, -7)
   arr.filter{i->i>0}.forEach{e->print("$e ")}
   println()
   println(arr.find{it%2==0})
   val temp=arr.reduce{value, next -> value*next+next}
   println(temp)
   println(arr.any{it%2>=1})
   println(Arrays.toString(arr.sortedArray()))
}

Options

  1. 5 3 6 2 4 0
2
0
false
[6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 0, -1, -7]
  2. 5 3 6 2 4 0
2

true

true

What is the output of the following code:

import java.util.Arrays
fun main(){
   val arr=arrayOf(3, 6, 2, 7, 4)
   val temp=arr.get(4)
   arr.set(4, 5)
   var count=0
   if(temp>arr.get(4)){
      count++
   }
   else{
      count=0
   }
   
   val arr1=arr.plus(count)
   print(Arrays.toString(arr1))
}

There is an extension function for an array in Kotlin which will return boolean value i.e., true when the array at least has one element in it or when the element matches the predicate. But, the given code is not used for this functionality.

Code

fun <A> Array<out A>.all():Boolean

Pick the correct function that is used to achieve the above functionality.

Options

  1. fun <A> Array<out A>.asIterable():Boolean
  2. fun <A> Array<out A>.any():Boolean
  3. fun <A> Array<out A>.asSequence():Boolean
  4. fun <A> Array<out A>.associate():Boolean

Lisa is using Arrays in VanillaJS. She has initialized an Array with company names. She wants to create a new iterator object carrying values for each index of that previous array. Then which of the methods can she use for such desired output?

Mark is using Arrays in VanillaJS. He has an Array with employee names. He wants to copy a part of the previous array with its elements and using a method return a modified array. Then which of the methods can he use for such output?

John is using Arrays in VanillaJS. He has an array with some elements and he wants to apply a function against an accumulator. Also, for each value of the array from left to right has to be reduced to a single value. Then which of the inbuilt methods can he use for such output?

Bob is using Arrays in VanillaJS. He has filled an Array with winners names of competition and now he wants to create a new array with the last index of an element within the array equal to an input element. Then which of the inbuilt methods can he use?

Bob is using Arrays in VanillaJS. He has an Array with some elements and he wants to create a new array using an array method which forms by applying a given callback function to each element of the array. Also, the new array list should be flattening the result by one level. Then for this requirement what can be used?

Mark is using Arrays in VanillaJS. He has initialized arrays and added some data. Now he wants to inject the data from the Array to HTML.

Code:

const data = ["John", "Mark", "Ben", "Lisa"];

data.splice(2, 0, "Anita", "Bob");
document.getElementById("others").innerHTML = data;

data.splice(1, 1, "Mary");

document.getElementById("members").innerHTML = data;

Then what will be the difference in the output?

Options

1.

John,Mark,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa
John,Mary,Mark,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa

2.

John,Mark,Ben,Lisa
John,Mark,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa

3.

John,Mary,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa
John,Mark,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa

4.

John,Mark,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa
John,Mary,Anita,Bob,Ben,Lisa

Mark is using Arrays in VanillaJS. He has initialized arrays and added some data. Now, he wants to inject the data from the array to HTML.

document.getElementById("winners").innerHTML = data.toString();

document.getElementById("members").innerHTML = data;

Then what will be the difference in the output?

"John","Mark","Ben","Lisa"

In data structures, what is the time complexity of the following code:

void func_hack(int m, int n, int mat[r][c])
  int i, k = 0, l = 0
  while (k < m && l < n)
    for i=l to n
	  PRINT mat[k][i]
	   k++;
	for i=k to m 
	  PRINT mat[i][n - 1]
	   n--
	if (k < m) 
	for i=n-1 to l 
	  PRINT mat[m - 1][i]
	   m--
	if (l < n) 
	for i=m-1 to k 
	  PRINT mat[i][l]
	   l++

In Data Structures, you are working on Arrays. You are given a Pseudocode that implements various operations on the given array. If you are required to execute the following pseudocode in a programming language then what will be the output?

DECLARE arr : ARRAY[0,8] of { 2, 4, 7, 10, 14, 27, 39, 52, 67 }
lo = 0
hi = 8
k=52
count = 0

WHILE lo < hi
	count = count + 1
	m=(lo + hi)/2
	IF arr[m]==k
		BREAK
	ELSE IF arr[m]<k
		lo = m + 1
	ELSE
		hi = m - 1
	ENDIF
ENDWHILE

PRINT count

If you are required to perform the following operations then what will be the final value of the variable count, after performing the operations?

You have a C# code given below having a missing line of code (YYY). Now, which of the given statements is correct if the code is executed using the following syntaxes consecutively in place of YYY?

Code:

using System;
public class Hack
{
    public static int hackOpr(int[] Array)
    {
        int max = Array[0] * Array[1];
        for (int x = 1; x <= Array.Length - 2; x++)
        { 
            YYY 
            
        }
        return max ;
 }
 public static void Main()
 {
     Console.WriteLine(hackOpr(new int[] {1, -3, 4, -5, 1}));
     Console.WriteLine(hackOpr(new int[] {1 , 3, 4, 5, 2}));
     Console.WriteLine(hackOpr(new int[] {1 , 3, -4, 5, 2}));
     Console.WriteLine(hackOpr(new int[] {1 , 0, -4, 0, 2})); 
     
 } 
    
}



Syntaxes

  1. max = Math.Max(max , Array[x] / Array[x + 1]);


     

  2. max = Math.Max(max , Array[x] * Array[x - 1]);


     

  3. max = Math.Max(max , Array[x] * Array[x + 1]);


     

  4. max = Math.Max(max , Array[x] / Array[x - 1]);

     

 

 

Statements

  1. Syntax 1 gives an output and a runtime error


     

  2. Syntax 2 gives an output and does not throw any error


     

  3. Syntax 3 gives an output and does not throw any error


     

  4. Syntax 4 gives an output and throws a runtime error

In the given C# code, which of the following can be used in place of XXX and YYY to produce the output as follows?

Code:

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
class Hackster
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        Stack<string> hack_animals = new Stack<string>();
        hack_animals.Push("dog");
        hack_animals.Push("bat");
        hack_animals.Push("cow");
        hack_animals.Push("rat");
        hack_animals.Push("cat");
        foreach( string h in hack_animals )
        { 
            Console.WriteLine(h); 
            
        }
        hack_animals.Pop();
        hack_animals.Peek();
        hack_animals.Pop();
        Stack<string> hack = new Stack<string>(hack_animals.ToArray());
        
        XXX
        hack_animals.CopyTo(hack_array, hack_animals.Count);
        Stack<string> hack3 = new Stack<string>(hack_array);
        
        Console.WriteLine(YYY
        hack.Clear();
        Console.WriteLine("\n"+ hack.Count); 
        
    } 
    
}

 

 

Output

cat
rat
cow
bat
dog

False

0

 

 

 

  1. XXX: hack.Contains("rat"));

YYY: string[] hack_array = new string[hack_animals.Count * 2];


     

  2. XXX: string[] hack_array = new string[hack_animals.Count * 2];

YYY: hack.Contains("rat"));


     

  3. XXX: string[] hack_array = new string[hack_animals.Count * 4];

YYY: hack.Contains("cat"));


     

  4. XXX: string[] hack_array = new string[hack_animals.Count / 2];

YYY: hack.Contains("cow"));

In Java, you are working on collection frameworks. You are given the following Java code that performs operations on an Array.

 

Code

import java.util.ArrayList; 
 
class Example {
    public static void main(String[] args) {  
        ArrayList names = new ArrayList();  
        names.add("Alice");   
        names.add("Bob");
        ArrayList list = new ArrayList();  
        list.add("A");
        list.add("B");
        names.addAll(list);
        System.out.println(names);   
    }     
}

 

Which of the following outputs will the above Java code produce?

 

Outputs

1. 

[A, B, Alice, Bob]

 

2. 

[Alice, Bob, A, B]

a.option: This code will give compilation error
This code will give runtime error

q:
In Java, you are working on Collection Frameworks. What is the output of the following java code?

 

Code

import java.util.ArrayList; 
 
class Example {
    public static void main(String[] args) {  
        ArrayList list_1 = new ArrayList();
        list_1.add("Tara");
        list_1.add("Lisa");
        ArrayList list_2 = new ArrayList();  
        list_2.addAll(list_1);
        list_2.add(0,"Alice");   
        list_2.add(1,"Bob"); 
        list_2.add(4, "Tara");
        list_2.remove("Tara");
        System.out.println(list_2);    
    }     
}

 

Which of the following outputs will the above Java code produce?
 

Outputs

1. 

[Alice, Bob, Lisa]

 

2. 

[Alice, Bob, Tara, Lisa]

 

3. 

[Alice, Bob, Lisa, Tara]

a.option: This code will give runtime error

q:

Code

import java.util.ArrayList;

        ArrayList list = new ArrayList();  
        list.add("Alice");   
        list.add("Bob"); 
        list.add(1, "Mike");
        list.add(3, "Tara");
            // Line 10

}

output

[Alice, Mike, Bob]

 

Code Snippets

1.

list.remove("Tara");

 

2.

3.

4.

In Java, you are working on Collection Frameworks. You are given the following Java code that performs operations on an Array. What is the output of the following Java code?

 

Code

import java.util.ArrayList;

class Example
{
	public static void main (String[] args)
	{
	    ArrayList list = new ArrayList();  
        list.add("Alice");   
        list.add(Boolean.TRUE); 
        list.add(1,"Bob"); 
        list.remove("true");
        list.add(1, "Mike");
        list.add(4, "Tara");
        System.out.println(list); 		
	}
}

 

Which of the following outputs will the above Java code produce?

 

Outputs

1. 

[Alice, Mike, Bob, Tara]

 

2. 

[Alice, Mike, Bob, true, Tara]

a.option: This code will give compilation error
This code will give runtime error

In Java, you are working on collection frameworks. You are given the following Java code that performs operations on an Array. What is the output of the following Java code?

 

Code

import java.util.ArrayList; 
 
class Example {
    public static void main(String[] args) {  
        ArrayList list = new ArrayList();  
        list.add("Alice");   
        list.add(Boolean.TRUE); 
        list.add("Bob");    
        System.out.println(list);    
    }     
}

 

Which of the following outputs will the above Java code produce?

 

Outputs

1. 

[Alice,  Bob]

 

2. 

[Alice, true, Bob]

 

3. 

[Alice, 1, Bob]

a.option: This code will give compilation error

In Data Structures, you are working on Arrays. You are given a Pseudocode that implements various operations on the given array. If you are required to execute the following pseudocode in a programming language then what will be the output?

DECLARE arr : ARRAY[0,7] of { 56, 34, 27, 75, 49, 53, 16, 65 }

FOR i -> 0 to 7 :
	PRINT arr[7-i]
ENDFOR

In Data Structures, you are working on arrays. You are given the following Pseudocode that represents rearranging of the elements in the array such that every element of the array is equal to its corresponding index value (array[x]=x).

DECLARE arr : ARRAY[0,9] of {8, 2, 5, 1, 6, 3, 7, 0, 9, 4}
n = 10
i = 0
WHILE i<n
	IF arr[i]>=0 and arr[i]!=i
		  //  Line 6
	ELSE
		i=i+1
ENDWHILE

Now, which of the following logic is used to replace the comment Line 6 such that the code executes the operation successfully?
Note : The function SWAP(x,y) swaps the values of x and y.

In Javascript, you have the following array of integers and want to determine the maximum value in the array. Which of the syntaxes given below will produce the desired result?

console.log(Math.max(...x));


2.

console.log(Math.max.apply(Math, x));


3.

Which of the following syntaxes can be used in place of XXX and YYY in the Javascript code given below to produce the output as follows?

Code

function fun1(y, z) 
{
    return this.p + this.q + y + z;
}

var add = {p: 10, q: 20}; 
XXX
YYY

 

Output

100
140


Syntaxes

1. XXX - fun1.call(add, 30, 40); 
    YYY - fun1.bind(add, [50, 60]);

2. XXX - add.call(fun1, 30, 40);
    YYY - add.apply(fun1, 50, 60);

4. XXX - fun1.call(add, 30, 40);

In Javascript, consider the array given below and determine the output of the following operations on the array?

Array

let abc = [3, 6, 9, 12];

 

Operations

Operation A

abc.fill(2, 2);
console.log(abc.toString());

 

Operation B

abc.fill(0, 1, 3);
console.log(abc.toString());

 

Operation C

abc.copyWithin(2, 0);
console.log(abc.toString());

 

Operation D

abc.copyWithin(2, 0, 1);
console.log(abc.toString());

 

Output

 

  1. A 3, 6, 2, 2

B 3, 0, 0, 12

C 3, 6, 3, 6

D 3, 6, 3, 12

                                                                                                                                                                                              

  2. A 2, 2, 9, 12

B 3, 0, 0, 12

C 3, 6, 3, 6

D 2, 6, 9, 12

                                                                                                                                                                                              

  3. A 3, 6, 2, 2

B 3, 0, 0, 0

C 9, 12, 9, 12

D 2, 2, 9, 12   

                                                                                                                                                                                                  

  4. A 3, 6, 2, 12

B 3, 3, 6, 12

C 3, 6, 3, 12

D 3, 6, 3, 12

Determine the output of the Javascript code snippet given below:

Code

var demo = {};
var x = { id: 1},
y = { id: 2};
demo[x] = "alpha";
demo[y] = "beta";

Determine the output of the C# code snippet given below:

Code

using System;

class Hackerearth
{
    static void hack_func(ref int[] h)
    {
        for (int hack_itr = 0; hack_itr < h.Length; hack_itr=hack_itr+2)
        {
            h[hack_itr] = h[hack_itr] + 15;
        }
        Console.WriteLine(string.Join(",", h));
    }
    
    static void Main(string[] args)
    { 
        int[] hack = new int[] {5,8,4,7,9 };
        hack_func(ref hack );
    }
}

  2. 5,8,4,7,9
  3. 20,8,19,7,24
  4. 5,23,4,22,9

If the following is the input, then determine the output of the following C code:

Input

3 2 1 3

Code

#include<stdio.h>
int main()
{
    int n,s[1001],i,t,j;
    scanf("%d",&n);
    for(i=0;i<n;i++)
    {
        scanf("%d",&s[i]);
    }
    for(i=0;i<n;i++)
        for(j=i+1;j<n;j++)
            if(s[j]<s[i])
            {
                t=s[j];
                s[j]=s[i];
                s[i]=t;
            }
    int c=n/2-1;
    int d=(n+1)/2-1;
    if(n%2!=0) 
        printf("%d",s[d]);
    else 
        printf("%d",s[c]);
}

In Data Structures, you have executed the following pseudocode to perform an operation with the following input values. Determine x with the respect to the following input values:

Pseudocode

input A,B n*n matrix
output C n*n matrix
define i, j, k
for i from 0 to n
   for j from 0 to n
      C[i,j] = 0
   end for
end for
for i from 0 to n
   for j from 0 to n
      for k from 0 to n
          C[i, j] = C[i, j] + A[i, k] * B[k, j]
      end for
   end for
end for

Input values:

N = 2
A[N][N] = { {1, 2},
            {3, 4}
          }
B[N][N] = { {5, 4},
            {1, 2}
          }

Output

C[N][N] = x

7 19
8 20

2.

8 20
7 19

3.

7 8
19 20

4.

19 20
7 8

In Data Structures, Determine the x in the following pseudo-code with the respect to the given input.

input: array HackArr[] = {1,1,5,5,2,2,7}   
output: x
N = length of HackArr
for i from 1 to N-1 do
  j = i
  while (j>0) and (hackArr[j] < HackArr[j-1]) do
     k = HackArr(j)
     HackArr(j) = HackArr(j-1)
     HackArr(j-1) = k
     j = j-1
  end-do
end-for

In Data Structures, you are given the following two arrays arr1[] and arr2[]. If you are required to check both of the arrays are permutations to each other then which of the following techniques can be implemented in this scenario:

Arrays

arr1[] = {1, 3, 5, 2, 2, 5, 6, 4}
arr2[] = {4, 1, 2, 3, 5, 2, 6, 5}

Techniques

  1. Sort both the arrays and compare both the arrays. If both the arrays are identical, then return true. Otherwise return false
  2. Create a Hash Map for all the elements of arr1[] such that all the elements from the array are keys and their corresponding frequencies in the array are values. Now, traverse arr2[] and search for each element of arr2[] in the hash map. If an element is found then decrement its count in the hash map. Otherwise, return false. If all elements are found and the value of every key in the hash map is equal to zero, then return true. Otherwise, return false.
  3. Create a circular linked list such that all the elements from both arr1[] and arr2[] are inserted into this linked list. Now, apply DFS technique on arr2[]. If elements found, then return true. Otherwise, return false.
